intro: Oliganthes pseudocentauropsis, commonly known as the false centaury, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, seed-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
